meanings.definition: Of a noble or elevated nature
meanings.sent1: The king's crown was a symbol of his loftier status among the people.
meanings.sent2: The mountain peak stood as a loftier point than any other in the range.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought he was loftier than the other animals because he could climb the tallest trees.
meanings.sent4: Her aspirations reached loftier heights than anyone had imagined.
meanings.sent5: The eagle soared to even loftier altitudes, showcasing its majestic nature.

meanings.sent1: The loftier officials in the company had reserved parking spots.
meanings.sent2: The CEO held a loftier position than the interns.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed it was loftier than the dog because it got to sit on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: Her salary was loftier than that of her colleagues, reflecting her seniority.
meanings.sent5: The castle on the hill was a symbol of the town's loftier residents.

meanings.sent1: His loftier principles guided him to always do the right thing.
meanings.sent2: The loftier values of honesty and integrity were instilled in the children.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape made him feel loftier than a regular person.
meanings.sent4: Her poetry reflected loftier emotions that touched the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a scene of loftier beauty, capturing the essence of nature.
